roleset.name: fascinate
roleset.note: FASCINATE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fascinate' based on wsj; nominal 'fascination' based on BOLT-7. Member of VNcls amuse-31.1. (from fascinate.01-v)
FASCINATION-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from fascination.01-n)
FASCINATING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from fascinating.01-j)

example.name: passive
example.text: And, since [the public]-1 has always been fascinated *trace*-1 by gossip and voyeurism, reporters and editors will strain for creative angles to justify the inclusion of collateral facts about private lives including sexual activities and domestic relationships, activities of family members, and all matters about mental and physical health.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John fascinated Mary with his tales of adventure in the Great White North.
example.arg: with his tales of adventure in the Great White North

example.name: Adjective example: fascinating
example.text: The color theory is so fascinating to me.

example.name: nominal rel: fascination
example.text: . The Spring Festival gala should be human performances . Joy will be brought to the audiences by means of human performances . The audiences can also enjoy the fascination of the Chinese culture .
